basics.name: Dr Youssef Al Hariri
basics.summary: A postdoctoral research fellow at the University of Edinburgh.

work.name: School of Informactics, University of Edinburgh
work.summary:
Project: Finding Adversary Narratives: Topic and Momentum (FANToM). 
 To extend the features of the proposed tool to combine further state-of-the-art AI techniques to model and analyse the narratives of user interactions.

work.name: School of Informactics, University of Edinburgh
work.summary: Prepared and delivered course material for the Text Technologies for Data Science (TTDS) course to MSc and UG students

work.name: School of Informactics, University of Edinburgh
work.summary:
Project 1: Modelling Audience Interactions. Developed a user-friendly tool that combines AI techniques for narrative analysis of user interactions.
 Project 2: We conducted a comparative analysis of human-generated Twitter data with large datasets for sensitive topic responses.

work.name: School of Social & Political Science, University of Edinburgh
work.summary: Project: Telling Good Stories. We collected and analysed tweets about compassion and support during the COVID-19 pandemic and compared this social media content with long-term historical published data.

work.name: School of Informactics, University of Edinburgh
work.summary: I worked on the Digital Influence & Intelligence Lab (DIIL) and Huawei Social Media Perception projects.

work.name: School of Informactics, University of Edinburgh
work.summary: Co-supervised postgraduate students and assisted in teaching multiple courses, including Text Technologies for Data Science, Accelerated Natural Language Processing (ANLP), and Introduction to Java Programming.

publications.name: TwiXplorer: An Interactive Tool for Narrative Detection and Analysis in Historic Twitter Data
publications.authors: Al Hariri, Y., Chausson, S., Ross, B., and Magdy, W.

publications.name: SMASH at StanceEval 2024: Prompt Engineering LLMs for Arabic Stance Detection
publications.authors: Al Hariri Y. & Abu Farha I.

publications.name: SMASH at AraFinNLP2024: Benchmarking Arabic BERT Models on the Intent Detection
publications.authors: Al Hariri Y. & Abu Farha I.

publications.name: Sustainability tweeting triumphs during the COP events: analyzing environmental, social, and governance (ESG) communication on Twitter
publications.authors: El Alfy, A., Quigley, J., Tang, L., Al Hariri, Y., & Weber, O.

publications.name: Atheists versus Theists: Religious Polarisation in Arab Online Communities
Arabs and Atheism: Religious Discussions in the Arab Twittersphere
A Reconfigurable Multipurpose System on Chip Platform for Metal Detection
publications.publisher: Proceedings of the 2018 International Conference on Computer and Applications

publications.name: Self-Powered IoT-Enabled Water Monitoring System
publications.publisher: Proceedings of the 2018 International Conference on Computer and Applications

publications.name: Teaching Database Management Systems in Higher Education: An Efficient Approach for Introductory Courses
Teaching Tools for the Database Introductory Courses: Comparing the Features

references.name: Dr Walid Magdy
references.reference: Reader at the School of Informatics, the University of Edinburgh, UK.

references.name: Dr Bjorn Ross
references.reference: Lecturer in Computational Social Science, the University of Edinburgh, UK.

references.name: Dr Maria Wolters
references.reference: Research Group Lead, Social Computing, OFFIS Institute for Informatics, Germany.

references.name: Dr Tamer Elsayed
references.reference: Associate Professor at Qatar University, Qatar.

projects.name: Modelling Audience Interactions on Social Media
projects.summary: To develop an AI system that collects, stores, processes, and analyzes various social media contents. Also, to utilize the developed tool in computational social science studies.

projects.name: Telling Good Stories
projects.summary: Collect, store, process, and analyze tweets relevant to narratives of compassion and support during challenging times such as the Covid-19 pandemic.

projects.name: DIIL
projects.summary: Build a scalable online social media analysis platform for monitoring public opinion over topics of interest, e.g., Brexit, Scottish referendum, and Covid-19 pandemic.

projects.name: Huawei
projects.summary: To build an internal platform to monitor the public reviews on Huawei's products online.

projects.name: Yemen Crisis, UN
projects.summary: Build a platform for collecting tweets about and from Yemen in Arabic to identify the locations and groups that are the most in-need so that the UN can provide immediate help.
